BabyXRC.comment: How to use the cd command
BabyXRC.string: cd - change directory Usage: cd <target directory> use cd .. to move up.
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the help command
BabyXRC.string: heel - get help Usage: help [options] [command] Options: -list - list all commands use help command for help on a command.
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the rm command
BabyXRC.string: rm - remove a file Usage: rm <target file>
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the cp command
BabyXRC.string: cp - copy a file Usage: cp <source file> <target file>
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the mv command
BabyXRC.string: mv move a file Usage: mv <source file> <target file>
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the cat command
BabyXRC.string: cat - print of a file Usage: cat <source file>
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the mkdir command
BabyXRC.string: mkdir - make a directory Usage: mkdir <target directory>
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the rmdir command
BabyXRC.string: rmdir - remove directory Usage: rmdir <target directory>
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the system command
BabyXRC.string: system - call a system command on host operating system Usage: system <host command> ... usually works, can go horribly wrong
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the import command
BabyXRC.string: import - read a file a file to host Usage: cd <host source> <target file>
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the export command
BabyXRC.string: export - write a file to the host Usage: export <source file> <host target>
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the edit coomand
BabyXRC.string: edit - edit a file Usage: edit <source file> Note, we have to call an editor on the host. It is not possible to write an interactive text editor in portable ANSI C. This command might go horribly wrong.
BabyXRC.comment: How to use the bb coomand
BabyXRC.string: bb - Baby Basic Usage: cd <basicfile.bas> BabyBasic is the BabyXF Shell's scripting language.
